Carrefour (French pronunciation: ) covers an area of 2,400 to 23,000 square metres (about 800 to 7,000 sq ft) and offers 20,000 to 80,000 products. As of June 2017, Carrefour has 1,507 wholesale stores, of which 243 are located in France, 458 in other European countries, 338 in Latin America, 370 in Asia and 94 in other countries. In some markets, wholesale warehouses open to individuals are being developed, such as Atacadão. With an area of 1,000 to 3,500 square metres (about 300 to 1,000 sq ft), the brand identification of these stores includes Market and Bairro. As of June 2017, Carrefour has 3,194 supermarkets worldwide, of which 1,059 are located in France, 1,753 in other European countries, 149 in Latin America, 43 in Asia and 190 in other countries.

The Kuiper belt is the source of short-period comets, such as Halley's Comet. Since the discovery of Pluto, astronomers have argued that it should be excluded from the Solar System. Because Pluto's size is similar to that of the larger asteroids in the Kuiper belt, it was argued at the end of the 20th century that it should be included among the Kuiper belt asteroids; Pluto's moons should be considered as its companions. In August 2006, the International Astronomical Union (IAU) removed Pluto from the category of exoplanets and assigned it to a new type of dwarf planet, along with Ganymede and the newly discovered Uranus. The Kuiper belt should not be confused with the hypothetical Oort Cloud, which is more than a thousand times larger than the former. Objects in the Kuiper belt, along with members of the Disc and any potential Oort Cloud objects, are collectively referred to as extra-Neptunian objects (TNOs). Pluto is the largest object in the Kuiper belt, and the second known extra-Neptunian object is Uranus in the Disc.

The Qing government only had to appoint Xu Jingcheng and Zhang Zhuang as the road superintendent and assistant ministers, and signed the 35-article "Zin Zhen Railway Loan Draft Contract" with Ying Huifeng and Dehua Banks on April 9, 1925 in Guangxu. From 1905, under the influence of the Guangdong-Han Railway Reclamation Movement, the gentlemen of Jiangsu, Lu and Su Provinces demanded that the "Zin Zhen Loan Draft Contract" be abolished and handed over to the local government. The railway plan was proposed for many years by Li Hongzhang, Liu Mingchuan, Zeng Jiao, Yuan Shikai, Yong Xing and other senior officials of the Qing court, and the end points of the line were constantly changing: Beijing Qing, Beijing Zhen, Zin Zhen, etc., and finally changed to Nanjing Pukou in 1908. Initially, the direction of this north-south railway plan was: the railway turned southeast in Xuzhou, along the west bank of the Great Canal of Beijing and Hangzhou, successively through Shuqiang, Huai'an and Yangzhou, and finally across the Yangtze River, and the Zhenjiang linked Shanghai to the Zhenjiang railway.

It covers 220.8 degrees of the night sky, accounting for 0.535 percent of the total, and can be seen in 88 modern constellations in the 65th row, south of 52 degrees north latitude. Lacaille assigns the Greek letters α to λ to the stars in the constellation of Lacaille by the Bayer nomenclature, which skips ι and κ. Lacaille belongs to the nautical instruments, not an essential part of the "Southern Ship", and in the 18th century the constellation of Lacaille was subdivided into the constellations of Boötes, Taurus, and Canis Majoris. The Greek letters assigned to the stars by the Bayer nomenclature are independent of the constellation of Lacaille. The 3.68-magnitude Canis Majoris is the brightest star in the constellation. Lacaille shows the star Kappa Lacaille but does not assign the Greek letters, and Gold later felt that the star was bright enough to assign the letter Kappa. T Lacaille is located about 4 degrees northeast of Canis Majoris. TY Lacaille is an eclipsing binary with a magnitude ranging from 6.85 to 7.5 with a period of 3.2 days. AK Lacaille is a red giant and a semi-regular variable star of spectral class M5III, with a brightness ranging from 6.09 to 6.51 magnitudes.

The national flag of Lesotho is a three-coloured transverse flag in 2:3 scale, with a blue, white and green stripe as the base, and a black Basotho cap in the middle. Blue represents the sky, rain, white symbolizes peace, and green represents the blue earth of Lesotho. The black Basotho cap represents the people of Lesotho, composed of black people. The flag was launched on 4 October 2006 to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the independence of the Kingdom of Lesotho and to express the people's desire for peace. The 2006 version of the national flag of Lesotho, the third generation of the national flag adopted after the independence of the country, reproduces the theme of the 1966 version of the national flag, the Basotho cap, and the main colours inherited from the 1987 version of the national flag, white, blue and green, organically combining the characteristics of the first and second generations of the national flag.

Havana is the capital and largest city of Cuba, and Santiago is the second largest city. It is commonly believed that the word "Cuba" comes from the Taíno word "coabana", meaning "rich land" or "good place". In 2011, Raúl Castro succeeded his brother Fidel Castro as first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, and began a series of reforms until the normalization of relations with the United States in 2014, when Cuba was frozen. In 2018, Miguel Díaz-Canel became the new Chairman of the Cuban State Council, and the National Congress of People's Power passed a constitutional amendment, including the establishment of a tenure system for leaders and the recognition of private property, which was passed in a referendum in 2019. Under the new constitution, Cuba will establish the positions of President and Prime Minister, replacing the previous positions of Chairman of the State Council and Chairman of the Council of Ministers.

The Australian Capital Territory (ACT) is the seat of the Government of the Commonwealth of Australia and the smallest but most populous state-level administrative region in Australia. It lies entirely within the province of New South Wales and covers an area of 2,358 square kilometres. The capital of the Australian Capital Territory, also the capital of the Commonwealth of Australia, is located in the northern part of the territory, in Canberra. In the late 19th century, when the British colonies of Australia negotiated the formation of the Commonwealth, there was disagreement over the location of the Commonwealth capital between the two largest cities, Sydney and Melbourne. As a result, the Commonwealth Constitution of Australia, which came into force in 1901, stipulated that the new capital must be located within the province of New South Wales but must be within 100 miles of Sydney — thereby ensuring that the new capital would remain fairly distant from both Sydney and Melbourne.

Heritage Day is the national holiday of South Africa on 24 September. On this day, South Africans celebrate their cultural, religious and traditional diversity throughout the country's long history. In KwaZulu-Natal Province, Heritage Day is known as Chaka Festival to commemorate King Chaka of the Zulu. Chaka is an important figure who united the different Zulu people to form a cohesive nation. Every year, local people gather in front of the tomb of King Chaka to mourn him. In 1995, the new South African Parliament opposed the designation of 24 September as a national holiday, and the result was not accepted by the largely Zulu-affiliated Inkatha Liberal Party (IFP). Finally, the Parliament and the Liberal Party reached a consensus to designate 24 September as Heritage Day and as a national holiday.

Currently, Djibouti has the largest base of U.S. troops in Africa. Before the colonial invasion, Djibouti was ruled by the three sultans of Hausa, Tajula and Obok. In 1850, the French invaded Djibouti, occupied the entire territory in 1888, and established the French colonial government of Somalia in 1896. After World War II, African countries launched independence movements, and the independence of French Somalia was complicated by the rivalry between the Issa and Afar peoples. In 1967, the French government granted its de facto autonomy to the French overseas territories by a referendum. Subsequent parliamentary elections resulted in an overwhelming victory for the Progressive Party, which belonged to the Afar peoples. The Issa-dominated Independent African Peoples' Alliance also expanded its forces to demand independence. Therefore, on December 31, 1975, France declared its agreement to the independence of French Afar and Issa territories.

Earth's land covers 29% of the Earth's surface. "Continents" and "continents" are synonymous in English, but have different meanings in Chinese. In Chinese, "continent" is a term that focuses on natural geography, referring to an area of land larger than Greenland; while "continent" is a term that focuses on geopolitics, referring to a definite delimitation of continental boundaries that includes not only the mainland as a subject, but also the surrounding islands and even the continental shelf. Geographical education in different countries is determined by the education departments of the countries. Therefore, the boundaries and names of blocks and continents are often different. The seven continents are the most common demarcation pattern, with the seven continents ranging from large to small: Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe and Oceania/Australia Asia. Some countries, such as the United States and Australia, do not consider Oceania to be an island.

Deng Xiaoping's new ideas were quickly questioned by supporters of Mao Zedong's ideology and supporters of political liberalization, and at the same time, the reform and opening-up policies caused many social problems. On April 15, 1989, the death of Hu Yaobang, the former secretary-general of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, triggered student and mass mourning activities, thus prompting large-scale student demonstrations. After the end of the Sixty-fourth Incident in 1989, the thirteenth Central Committee of the Communist Party of China convened, decided to remove Zhao Ziyang's duties as the secretary-general of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, thus establishing Jiang Zemin's leadership position within the Communist Party of China, and establishing the third generation of central leaders, including Li Peng and Li Ruiyuan.

With the establishment of Guangzhou Second Bus Company on September 1, 1980, the former Guangzhou Bus Company was renamed Guangzhou First Bus Company. From 1984 to 1985, due to very low financial investment, the company borrowed money from banks and hired employees to purchase buses, and formed a new dedicated fleet. In November 1986, five bus routes and 12 units along the line, including Guangzhou Cultural Park and South Building, launched the "Friendship in the Car" campaign, and established the slogan "Friendship in the Car, Honesty as a Passenger." In 1987, double-decker buses were introduced in the form of advertising compensation, and in 1992, a reform was implemented on 13 bus routes, namely "Get on at the front door, get off at the back door." In August 1993, unmanned buses were introduced on 202 dedicated bus routes. On September 13, 1994, Hong Kong Lei Yi Industrial Co., Ltd. and Guangzhou First Bus Company jointly established the Sino-foreign cooperative bus enterprise Guangzhou Xinho Bus Co., Ltd.

Line 5 of the Guangzhou Metro is one of the operational lines of the Guangzhou Metro, which belongs to the City Tram Transportation, and is represented by the red color. This line is an east-west main line of the Guangzhou Metro network, currently has 24 stations and one carriage section. Currently, the line runs from Fangcun Kaukou, Lai Wan District, west to Wenchuan, Huangpu District, east. The carriages are composed of six L-shaped trains. Line 5 runs roughly east-west, slightly n-shaped, starting on the south side of Fangcun Avenue West, Kaukou Passenger Station, east side, along the Pearl River Bridge, the north side of the Pearl River Bridge, and the Pearl River Bridge radial line in parallel across the Pearl River to Da Tan Sha Island, from Tan O Station from the elevated platform into the underground, east through the South Shore Road and Zhongshan 8 Road intersection, then turn north through Pingxin Village, through a built-up area to West Village Station. Then laid out along the Ring Road Corridor. After the South Gate of the Zoo, turn south to Yang Mei Station.

The ratio of the radial velocity of the surface motion to the observer, due to the Doppler displacement, the radiation is transferred to a higher frequency. Similarly, the radial velocity of the area away from the observer, the radiation is transferred to a lower frequency. When the absorption spectral lines of the star are observed, the two-sided displacement causes the spectral width. However, be careful to separate this width from the other effects that cause the spectral width. The radial velocity of the observed spectral width is related to the inclination angle of the rotation axis to the estimator, the measured values are as follows: ve⋅sin⁡i {\displaystyle v_{e}\cdot \sin i}, where ve is the rotation speed of the equator, and i is the inclination angle. But i is usually not known, so this is the lowest speed of the star's rotation. That is, as long as i is not a straight angle, the real speed is greater than ve⋅sin⁡i {\displaystyle v_{e}\cdot \sin i}.

In 1907, he graduated, because of rumors outside the school at the time, the school received bribes for malpractice, causing dissatisfaction among the students. A student beat the school supervisor who malpracticed, the school authorities falsely accused him of inciting the students, and told Jiangsu patrol to arrest him. Later, he was released by his teacher Tao Xiaoxiang. In 1908, he went to the same village Chen resigned as the author of the Chinese New Journal because of illness, he recommended him to take up this post, so he took up the post from Shanghai to Shantou, where he met a close friend Lin Yichang. In the spring of 1909, the newspaper president Xie Yiqiang and Xie Liangmao introduced him to join the League.

Driving direction is an important part of the traffic rules of the world. It regulates the position of vehicles on the road to avoid confusion and accidents. Driving direction can be divided into vehicles driving on the left side of the road and driving on the right side of the road. On the basis of safety and other factors, traffic regulations in most countries do not allow the driver's seat to drive on the side of the road. Therefore, left-handed drivers almost all drive on the right side of the vehicle, called the right rudder, right axle or right-hand drive; while right-handed drivers drive on the left, called the left rudder, left axle or left-hand drive. 34% of countries drive on the left, 66% of countries drive on the right. In ancient China, pedestrians, horses and vehicles generally stop and walk on the left side of the passage, called "left-handed".

In the late 1990s, Yahoo!, MSN, Lycos, Excite, Chimo, and many other entry-level websites grew rapidly, and these entry-level companies expanded their services by merging with each other, hoping to increase the amount of time users spent on the site. On October 8, 1997, Yahoo! acquired Four11, the Internet mail service of Four11, Rocketmail eventually became Yahoo! Mail, and Yahoo! also acquired ClassicGames.com, the predecessor of Yahoo! Games.

Chemical symbols represent chemical elements or functional groups in the form of Latin abbreviations. Symbols of chemical elements are usually one or two letters long, while some artificial elements' IUPAC provisional symbols are three letters long. Chemical symbols of elements are used in elemental periodic tables, and are also used to write chemical formulas. For example, the following chemical equations for the reaction of hydrogen and oxidation to water: Most symbol abbreviations are from its English name, but some abbreviations are from its Latin or German name. Sodium (Na{\displaystyle {\ce {Na}}}) is from Latin sodium, tungsten (W{\displaystyle {\ce {W}}}) is from German tungsten. In addition, the isotope deuterium of hydrogen (H2{\displaystyle {\ce {^2H}}}) is represented by D{\displaystyle {\ce {D}}} and (H3{\displaystyle {\ce {^3H}}}) is represented by T{\displaystyle {\ce {T}}}.

During the reign of Ming Cheng Tai, "Zenhua Li" was established on both sides of Zeng Wenxi, returned to the jurisdiction of Tianxing County, and dispatched troops to settle there. "Zenhua Li" is far more extensive than the present-day Zenhua District, even within the present-day Nanxi District, later divided into "Zenhua Li West Fort" and "Zenhua Li East Fort." During the Qing Dynasty, this place was located inside the bend of Zeng Wenxi River Road, called "Wanli Sha"; later, the Chinese gradually gathered and developed the city, renamed "Wanli Street", belonged to Anping County, Tainan Prefecture, and had the jurisdiction of "Cruise." After Taiwan was ceded to Japan by the Treaty of Imaguan, in 1895 (Japan Meiji 28), the Japanese colonial authorities first established "Zenhua Military Station Command", military jurisdiction of "Zenhua Li East Fort" and "West Fort"; in 1896 (Japan Meiji 29), it was renamed "Zenhua Military Camp", the same year began to implement civilian rule, changed to "Wanli Administration Office".

After graduating from university, he joined the army on October 8, 1972, was assigned to the Naval Reserve Service, received three months of basic training in the Republic of China Navy Marine Corps, was subsequently promoted to the rank of Lieutenant Commander, Naval Logistics Command, Left Naval Base, and retired from the Navy on August 6, 1974 as a second lieutenant, totaling one year and ten months. In June 1968, he officially joined the Nationalist Party of China. In 1974, he received the Nationalist Party of China Zhongshan Scholarship to study in the United States. In 1977, he received a master's degree in law from New York University, the same year he married his master's student Zhou Meiqing. In November 1980, his eldest daughter Ma Weihong was born in the United States. In 1981, he received a doctorate in jurisprudence from Harvard University. During his stay in the United States, he formed the Anti-Communist Patriotic League, served as a director of the Middle East Region. He was the editor-in-chief of Boston Communications for five years. He wrote essays, editorials, essays, and more than 100,000 words under the pseudonyms of "Yiwu Tai," "Wang Shaolin," "Li Nanqiao," etc., criticized the Communist Party of China, Taiwanese separatists and overseas leftists, and collected Taiwanese separatists' materials.

Social science is a field of study that emerged only after the Enlightenment movement in the eighteenth century. Over time, it has also established the scope of its research subjects, and the concepts of social science have broad and narrow meanings. In 1968, published in Taiwan, the Yuan Five Dictionary of Social Sciences further defined the following twelve social science research subjects, including: psychology, education, statistics, law, politics, administration, international relations, economics, sociology, anthropology, history, and geography. Social science includes: politics, economics, sociology is a typical social science in a narrow sense. Some disciplines, such as history, are a cross between the narrow social sciences and the humanities, but are usually understood as the humanities.

Since then, Putin has won the 2000 and 2004 presidential elections. Due to the constitutional restrictions on re-election, he was unable to participate in the 2008 Russian presidential elections. Subsequently, the candidate nominated by Putin, Dmitri Medvedev, was elected President of Russia. On May 7, 2008, after Putin stepped down as President, President Medvedev nominated Putin for the second time as Prime Minister, continuing to control the country. In 2012, Putin ran for the third time in the presidential election and won and resigned from the chairmanship of the Unified Russia Party, and ran for the fourth time in the 2018 general election for re-election, serving until 2024. On March 14, 2020, Putin signed the "Amendment to the Constitution of the Russian Federation," which he proposed, allowing him to run for two more presidents, breaking the then constitutionally restricted term. The amendment was originally scheduled for a national vote on April 22, 2020, but was delayed due to the COVID-19 epidemic, and the proposal was passed in July.

The total length of the line is about 61.5 km. The track has a Zhenlong car park (shared with Line 14), located on the north side of Zhenlong Station; at the same time, two parking spaces have been installed, one on the east side of Yamada Station and the other on the north side of Mizuishi Station. The section from Huangcun to Mizuishi of Line 21 originally belonged to the northern extension of Line 4, and at the end of 2010, in order to promote the development of northern Luogang in the east and Qiancheng in the west, this section was separately planned and extended to both ends, becoming Line 21. Due to the location of the express line of Line 21, some stations in the section from Huangcun to Mizuishi were cancelled, at that time 17 stations were planned. Cosmogony (also translated as cosmological evolution) refers to a variety of theories, theories and religious doctrines concerning the origin and evolution of celestial bodies and the universe. The word is derived from the Greek κορχογονία (orκορχογενία), composed of κοσμος (cosmology, the world) and ἄγ)νοι (orγέγονα, origin). Numerous theories on the evolution of celestial bodies have been proposed since ancient times. Some ancient Greek philosophers believed that chaos created the cosmos. In the ancient Chinese Taoist textbook Huainanzi Astronomical Instructions, there is a saying that "there is a boundless air, and the clear sun is the sky, and the cloudy cloud is the earth.... the cold air of the clouds is water, and the essence of the water is the moon; and the lewd air of the sun and the moon is the star."

The South African National Defence Force (SANDF) is the armed forces of South Africa. The commander of the South African National Defence Force is appointed by the President of South Africa from one of its units and reports to the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans of the Department of Defence. The current South African Defence Force was formed following the first national elections in 1994 following the end of apartheid and the adoption of a new constitution.

On April 11, 1931, Ma Bufang drove Ma Zhongying from the Three Forts and Six Dams of Minle County to the border of Zhangye to Anxi. The small fort is a village at the foot of the Hami Tianshan Mountain, a Uyghur woman Alisham, attracted the newly appointed small fort sentinel card officer Zhang Guoxuan. Zhang Guoxuan is a relative of Xinjiang Provincial President Jin Shuren, determined to marry this beautiful woman. Unsuccessful, decided to rob the bride. On the night of May 20, 1931 (April 4th of the lunar calendar), Zhang Guoxuan with 32 cartridges of live ammunition, when robbing the bride, was disguised as a bride, the accompanying strong lads captured alive, killed. Jin Shuren heard that the dispatch of troops to the general to kill the people who dare to kill his card officer, triggered a riot in the eastern frontier, the whole frontier.

In April 1984, the local population voted to annex the island to Australia. The ancestors of the inhabitants were the earliest workers and their families, most of whom were of Malay descent, who came to the island from Scotland in 1827-1831 with John Clunies-Ross. The inhabitants of the Cocos Islands, often referred to as the Cocos Malays, lived on the island of Hom with the descendants of John Clunies-Ross and are now mostly Australian citizens. In the mid-1950s, as the islands became overcrowded, many of the inhabitants of the Cocos Islands migrated to Australia, mainly to Western Australia. The inhabitants of the remaining islands were employed by the island's administrative authorities from the mainland and their families, who lived on West Island. Most of the inhabitants worked on coconut plantations on and around the island of Hom.

The term slave originates from ancient French "sclave", medieval Latin "sclavus" and Byzantine Greek "scleroios", which is due to the fact that many Slavs were captured as slaves in the early medieval wars. Slave as a term can also refer to a person who is attached to others. Slaves generally come from prisoners of war, indigenous peoples of the occupied territories, debtors, criminals, the poor, etc. Slaves in ancient and modern Europe were mostly trafficked from the coasts of sub-Saharan Africa and elsewhere. Slavery generally occurs in areas where manual industry and commerce are more developed, because slavery reduces production costs to the greatest extent. Most countries where slavery is legal also have laws capturing and punishing escaped slaves (equivalent to stealing the property of their masters). Slave ownership, also known as traditional slavery, is where slaves are treated as private property, and can be traded as commodities.

After World War II, Germany abandoned the traditional doctrine of command and control and replaced it with substantive command and control, with military orders and military government unified, with the Minister of Defense in peacetime, General Suleiman, in wartime, under the command of the Federal Chancellor; the President of the Federal Republic and unofficial command or control, only when the territory of the Federal Republic was attacked by force, with the consent of the Federal Parliament, declared a state of defence under international law. When Japan established the modern army during the Meiji Restoration, strongly influenced by the German Empire, the emperor was the commander of the army, established the headquarters of the army's staff and the navy's command department, and allowed both sides to directly report to the emperor's "report" powers, not only independently of the cabinet, and resulted in the unique situation of military orders and military government dual system, military orders were also unified into a large headquarters rather than a command department.

China Culture University (Chinese: 中國文化大学; pinyin: CCU) is a private university in Yangmingshan, Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan. It was founded in 1962. The original name of the university was "Far Eastern University". It was proposed by President Chiang Kai-shek to change the name to "China Culture College." It was approved by the Ministry of Education to upgrade the name to "China Culture University". It has been awarded the "Outstanding University for Teaching Excellence Program" by the Ministry of Education for eight consecutive years, and is a member of the "Shingxing Project University" and the "Yushu University Alliance." China Culture University has 13 faculties, 61 departments, 41 master's courses, 10 doctoral courses, and 21 departments to promote the Ministry of Education. Founder Zhang Qiyun is a historian and educator. He was the Minister of Education of the Republic of China, early on he was an important member of the South Higher School of History and the School of Economics. Afterwards, when he was appointed to teach at the National Central University, he was one of the soul figures of the National Cultural Society, a pioneer of modern Confucianism and the Chinese cultural revival movement.

State power has relative autonomy. In different historical periods, its degree of autonomy also varies. The influence on autonomy includes social crisis, social structure, administrative power. Discussion of the essence of power is a classical problem in politics. Early political scholars such as Plato, Aristotle and others believed that the essence of power is the best. By the Middle Ages, Augustine regarded power as a "secular city", that the secular world is not good. This idea has always influenced Machiavelli, and from Locke to Paine, state power has been transformed into "necessary evil". Marxism explored the essence of power from the point of view of the class, that the essence of the state is the essence of the class, and that state power is the product of an irreconcilable conflict of class interests. The city-states established by the Sumerians were generally regarded as the initial form of the state, and were later copied by many Mediterranean nations, among which the Jewish Greek Athens was the most characteristic, but in fact the most representative of the Roman Republic, and other city-states were often monarchs or aristocracies, such as Sparta in ancient Greece and Carthage in North Africa.

Steel structural engineering is an important part of Guangzhou South Railway Station. The waiting hall, roof and rain shelter of Guangzhou South Railway Station are all new rigid structures such as long span prestressed arch shell and three-way hinged arch. The roof of the station is equipped with a solar panel with an area of about 2,000 square meters. After the solar energy is converted into electricity, it is supplied directly to the station. Currently, the main structure of Guangzhou South Railway Station consists of five floors, including four floors above ground to the basement. The departure floor of the station is located on three floors above ground, for the elevated passenger waiting hall, the elevated waiting hall has an area of 71,722 square meters. In the 19th century, most of today's Eastern District was still a sparsely populated plain in the east and south-east of Tainan City. Due to the fact that there were no rivers in the high-lying area of Tainan, the area was mostly covered with dry land, and the wind was blowing through the sand, the industry was still dominated by farmers. Therefore, the Christian Presbyterian Church in Tainan City in the late Qing Dynasty, after the missionary work encountered the rejection of the inhabitants at that time, moved to the eastern part of the sparsely populated city. The Tainan Seminary (1882), Chorong Secondary School (1885), Chorong Middle School (1887) and the New Building Hospital in the Eastern District were established at that time and continue to this day. In the early days of Jing Dynasty, within the territory of today's Eastern District, there were a few small villages such as Emperor's Hall, Tiger's Tavern, King's Tavern, Taiya's Tavern, Go's Tavern, Xu's Tavern, Kudan's Tavern, Sanpo's Tavern, Chu's Tavern, Take's Tavern, and Tailu East.

The sun, moon, and earth must be more precisely aligned before a solar eclipse occurs. The moon must first reach the yellow and white intersection, and must converge with the time of the new moon. Moreover, the moon's orbit is elliptical, the distance between the Earth and the moon is near and far, so the moon's angular diameter is large and small. Only when the moon is close enough to the Earth is it possible to completely obscure the sun, a solar eclipse occurs. During a solar eclipse, the moon's shadow on the Earth sweeps a long path, only on this path can the eclipse be seen, so a solar eclipse is a very rare phenomenon for any single location on the Earth.

"The initial success of the National Revolution is the real beginning of the nation-building work. Our Chinese nation-building work has both domestic and international aspects." "The current stage of the National Revolution, from the completion of nationalism, to the implementation of civil rights and people's socialism." Asserting that China has only one nation, the Chinese nation. Chiang Kai-shek summarized China's 5,000-year history evolution and Confucian cultural foundations with his own world view, reviewing China's recent and modern history, asserting that the abolition of the unequal treaties is the result of belief in the Three-Nationalism, in particular, the Northern Expedition of the National Revolutionary Army and the War of Resistance against Japan. This book severely criticizes liberalism and communism, stating that both destroy traditional Chinese culture, the dispute between the two is a contradiction between Anglo-American thought and Soviet thought, and asserting that the Three-Nationalism is the "highest principle of national revolution invariant", "the only correct line of national revival", and other parties should abandon their respective claims.

Daylight saving time (DST) (also known as summer time in the United States and Canada) is the practice of speeding up the time at the expense of normal sunrise time in the summer months. A region that usually uses daylight saving time speeds up the time by one hour near the beginning of spring and returns to normal time in the fall. In 1895, George Hudson proposed the concept of daylight saving time. Daylight saving time is not generally used in Asia and Africa, so only a small minority of the world's population uses it. Sometimes, the conversion of daylight saving time makes reporting work more complicated, and disrupts travel, accounting, record keeping, medical facilities, and heavy equipment.

The Republic of Suriname (Dutch: Republiek Suriname), commonly known as Suriname (Dutch: Suriname), is a sovereign state located in North America, the North Atlantic Ocean, southern Brazil, eastern French Guiana, and western Guyana. It is currently a member of the Union of South American Nations. Formerly known as Dutch Guiana, the country was a Dutch colony in South America. It became an overseas autonomous province of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in 1954, and became independent in 1975. Suriname is the smallest country in South America in terms of both area and population, and the only country in the Western Hemisphere not part of the Kingdom of the Netherlands that uses the Dutch language as its official language. The capital, Paramaribo, is a trading port at the mouth of the Suriname River. Suriname is an extremely multi-ethnic, linguistic, and religious country, with a Muslim population of 13%, the highest proportion of any country in the Americas.

In 5000-4000 years ago, Henan was the center of China's Kyushu, Henan Province is the subject of the Chinese traditional geographical concept of "Central Plains," and "Central Province," Yuzhou, "Central soil," "Central summer," "China," the word "China" originates from Luoyang City, Henan Province. Henan, historically called "Central Plains," is one of the important birthplaces of the Huaxia civilization and one of the core regions of Chinese history. Luoyang (13th Dynasty), Kaifeng (7th Dynasty), Anyang (7th Dynasty), and Zhengzhou (5th Dynasty) are all famous millennium-old capitals.

On 8 February 1963, Saddam returned to Baghdad after the Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party's seizure of power in the Ramadan coup d'état, and began to take control of the party's internal powers. However, in November of the same year, President Aliyev launched a coup d'état against the Ba'ath Party; he was arrested by the authorities in November 1964. However, in 1966, he was elected deputy general secretary of the Ba'ath Party in prison, succeeding in escaping prison the same year; by this time, Saddam was the second leader of the Ba'ath Party, succeeding only to Abdulrahman Aliyev, and began to restructure the Ba'ath Party. In July 1968, he returned to Iraq to assist in the coup d'état, overthrew President Aliyev, and restored the Ba'ath Party to power; in November 1969, he became deputy secretary of the Revolutionary Command and Minister of Publicity and Security.

Yan Huiqing (Chinese: 颜惠庆; April 2, 1877 – May 24, 1950) was a Chinese politician and diplomat from Shanghai County, Jiangsu Province. His ancestors were from Shandong Province and later moved to southern Fujian Province. His father, Yan Yongjing, came to Shanghai from Fujian early in his life as a parish priest of Hongkou Anglican Church and one of the founders of St. John's University. He studied at St. John's College, Yinghua College, and Hongkou Documentary Institute. In 1895, he went to the United States to attend high school. In 1897, he entered the University of Virginia to study. During his time there, he was a teacher at a church school and was a member of the Chinese Embassy in the United States. In June 1900, Yan Huiqing graduated.

Yuri Vladimirovich Andropov (Russian: Ю́рий Влади́мирович Андро́пов, June 15, 1914 – February 9, 1984) was the Supreme Leader of the Soviet Union, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union from 1982 to 1984, Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the Soviet Union and Chairman of the Defense Council of the Soviet Union. From 1954 to 1957, Andropov served as the Soviet Ambassador to Hungary, participated in the activities to pacify the 1956 Hungarian Revolution. On May 10, 1967, he was appointed Chairman of the KGB. He oversaw the large-scale suppression of protests, which was carried out through large-scale arrests and large-scale implementation of involuntary psychiatric treatment of people considered "unpopular in society".

Margaret Hilda Thatcher, Baroness Thatcher LG OM PC FRS FRIC (13 October 1925 – 8 April 2013), commonly known by her maiden name Roberts, was a British politician who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1979 to 1990 and as Leader of the Conservative Party from 1975 to 1990.

The inhabitants of the Nguni slowly formed a group called the Southern Ndebele people, although the word "Ndebele" is translated as exile in Soto, and the river near where they lived was named after one of their chiefs, Tshwane, but because the word "Tshwane" means "little monkey" in Ndebele, it was directly translated into South African as the Apies River. Pretoria was founded in 1855 by the leader of the "Voortrekkers", Marthinus Wessel Pretorius, and named after his father, Andreas Pretoria.

The Republic of the Congo (French: République du Congo; Kituba: Repubilika ya Kongo; Lingala: Républiquei ya Kongó), abbreviated Congo, Brazzaville Congo or Congo (B), is a country in central Africa, with the capital in Brazzaville, bordering the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Gabon and Angola, and adjacent to the Gulf of Guinea. Historically controlled by the Bantu tribe, it became a French colony, French-speaking, and gained independence in 1960. Between 1970 and 1991, the country was called the People's Republic of the Congo, a Marxist-Leninist one-party state; in 1992, it changed to a multi-party system, but in 1997, the government collapsed in the civil war.

The Atlantic Ocean occupies 20% of the Earth's surface area, second only to the Pacific Ocean. Its surface area is estimated to be approximately 106,400,000 square kilometres (82,400,000 sq mi). The land area flowing into the Atlantic Ocean is four times that of the Pacific or Indian Ocean. The total capacity of the Atlantic Ocean is estimated to be 354,700,000 cubic kilometres (323,600,000 cubic kilometres). The average depth of the Atlantic Ocean is estimated to be 3,338 metres (3,900,000 ft). The depth of the Atlantic Ocean is estimated to be 3,926 metres (3,900,000 ft). The depth of the Atlantic Ocean is estimated to be 8,605 metres (3,900,000 ft) at the Puerto Rico Trench.

In May 1981, on the eve of her death, the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China decided to confer the title of Honorary President of the People's Republic of China on Song Qingling, the only person to have the title of Honorary President of the People's Republic of China to date, and the Politburo of the Communist Party of China also approved her joining the Communist Party of China. Song Qingling was revered by the Communist Party of China as "Mr. (Song) Qingling" and "Mrs. Sun"; was honored by Premier Zhou Enlai as "the treasure of the country" (later General Secretary of the Communist Party of China Jiang Zemin; there is a documentary of the same name); and the People's Republic of China was officially evaluated as "great patriotism, democracy, internationalism, communist warriors".

Ni Guizhen (Chinese: 倪珪珍; June 22, 1869 – July 23, 1931) was the mother of three sisters, Song Meiling, Song Qingling, and Song Meiling, and the wife of the Reverend Song Gaap. She was born in the Nijiayan people in the Shanghai Public Concession. On July 15, 1931, Song Meiling was accompanied by Lady Song, Song Xiaoliang, and Confucius Xi's children from Shanghai to Qingdao, with the protection of 18 people including the secretary of the Ministry of Finance, Zhiyuan Ben, and others: 152. On July 25, 1931, Song Meiling and Song Ziwen, Song Xiaoliang, Song Qingling, Song Xiaoliang, and Song Zi'an, and others, in Shanghai "Declaration" and "People's Daily" published "Death of Lady Song Mother Ni Tai" (152-153). Father Ni Jishan was also a Reverend, his mother's surname was Xu, and he was the descendant of Xu Guangqi. Ni Guizhen graduated from the Girls' School of Shanghai Yin Wen at the age of 17, excelled in mathematics, enjoyed playing the piano, and stayed at school as a teacher. In the summer of 1887, she married Song Gaap.

Guangzhou Bus is one of the main modes of transportation in Guangzhou. It is operated by the Guangzhou Municipal Government, which provides financial resources, the Guangzhou Public Transport Group's bus companies and some private bus companies. At the end of the 19th century, as buses were not yet widespread, the main means of transportation in Guangzhou were Japanese-imported Huangbao cars, i.e. "Oriental cars". At that time, the Huangbao car companies operating in Guangzhou - Liyuan, Xiang'an, Daiyi, Anle, etc. 10 companies had more than 200 Huangbao cars. Huangbao cars could pass guests by the route according to the door signs, which was convenient, so the business of Huangbao cars was long. After the Huangbao cars entered China, they were modified many times, and eventually converted to a motorcycle version. People were also upgrading the Huangbao cars with a batch of tricycle buses; and after the appearance of the tricycle buses, the Huangbao cars began to be phased out.

In 1932, Zhang Dongsheng and Zhang Junsheng formed the National Socialist Party of China (the predecessor of the People's Socialist Party), founded the "Regeneration" weekly, opposed the one-party dictatorship of the Kuomintang "outside the Party, no party", demanded the Kuomintang to end the training phase and implement the constitution. The Kuomintang inherited the "research department", participated in the National Senate of the Chongqing National Government. However, after the list of the second National Senate was published, the number of non-Kuomintang members decreased, in 1941, the Kuomintang and the Youth Party, the Chinese National Liberation Action Committee (later renamed the Chinese Farmers and Workers' Democratic Party), the Chinese People's National Salvation Congress, the Chinese Vocational Education Society and non-partisans formed the Alliance of the Chinese Democratic Party, hoping to become a powerful political force, counterbalance the Kuomintang, and the Kuomintang was one of the important members.

During the French Revolutionary War, European countries conquered by France, such as the First Republic of Spain, also formed regional committees to govern after the overthrow of the monarchy. After the October Revolution in Russia, the Russian Communist Party established Soviet rule, also a form of committee. Under the influence of the Soviet Union, the Republic of China also adopted a committee system during the period of national government, until 1946 after the constitutional reform, it changed to a cabinet system. In the past, many communist countries under the influence of the Soviet Union, many adopted Soviet-like committee system: such as the People's Republic of China, as the head of state, the President of the People's Republic of China, according to the legislative spirit is appointed by the National People's Congress to execute the joint resolutions of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, actually has no separate powers, formally belongs to the committee system; moreover, since the Chinese Communist Party is the sole governing party of the People's Republic of China, its highest authority - the permanent organ of the Central Committee, the Standing Committee of the Politburo of the Politburo of China as the party's highest decision-making body during the meetings of the Politburo and the closing of the Central Assembly, also corresponds to the country's actual highest decision-making body, its meetings under the auspices of the General Secretary to discuss major countries, this also has some features of the committee system.

In the early days of the Republic, the administrative districts of the country were adjusted several times, and counties replaced prefectural and provincial offices and became the most common administrative divisions at the grassroots level. The coexistence of the counties thus became the coexistence of the flag counties. Since the end of the Qing Dynasty, with the immigration of the Han and the reclamation of pastures, the Han population in Inner Mongolia has been growing steadily. The reclamation of pastures has more directly impacted the way of life of the Mongolian people. Since the 1900s, anti-reclamation has been the subject of the Dugonglong movement. Against this background, the national government has continued the management system of the end of the Qing Dynasty, and even the Manchurian government has implemented this management system, such as the Ao Han flag and the Xinhui county have jurisdiction over the same area.

In August 1959, Professor Li Weixiang, who was the headmaster of Taipei Technical Vocational School at the time, proposed that the school motto should be "Truthful, Simple, Thorough and diligent." With the agreement of Principal Zhang Dan, the school was requested to hold a school affairs meeting, and the school affairs meeting was passed, so that the school was formally endorsed by the Education Department and the Ministry of Education. The school song of the early industrial school was written in Japanese. In 1948, when Taipei Technical Vocational School was reorganized as an industrial specialty school, the headmaster at the time requested Professor Zhao Yujun to write the lyrics, and then the music teacher of the Taipei Technical Vocational School at the time, Professor Wu Kui-cheng composed the music. In the summer of 1948, the school affairs council was requested to hold a meeting, and the resolution of the headmasters of all levels of the council was passed, and the school motto was officially endorsed. (Chinese: 簡卓堅 詞 吳居徹 曲) Taipei Technical College Red Building was built in 1926 (Showa era, the 15th year of the National People's Republic), as the first surviving school building, the walls were all made of red brick and became known as Red Building.

General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union General Secretary of the President of the Soviet Union (1985–1991) President of the Soviet Union (1990–1991) After the end of the Soviet Union's foreign policy, economic reform (Russian: перестро́йка, pronounced, help·information, International Phonetic Alphabet: ) refers to a series of economic reform measures implemented by Mikhail Gorbachev, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union since June 1987. Together with the political reforms and open policies of the time, these reforms formed the key words of domestic policy during Gorbachev's rule. "перестро́йка" literally means "reconstruction", with the intention of changing the Soviet Union's stagnant economic situation.

MTR Corporation Limited (Chinese: 香港鉄道公司; pinyin: MTR; ICAO: 0066, OTCBB: MTRJY) was founded on 26 September 1975 as the Mass Transit Railway Corporation. It was privatised in 2000 and incorporated as a limited company on 26 April of the same year under the name of MTR Corporation Limited. Following the merger of two railways in 2007, the name was changed to its present name on 2 December 2007 through the transfer of operational rights to operate the network and operations of the Kowloon-Hong Kong Railway Company. The headquarters of the Hong Kong Railway Company Limited is located at 33 Defoe Square, Kowloon Bay, Hong Kong, on several floors of the Hong Kong Railway Headquarters Building and the 2nd floor of the International Financial Centre (including the 45th floor of the Board of Directors' Office). The main business is to operate the monopoly integrated railway network in Hong Kong—MTR, including the Kowloon-Hong Kong Railway Company system under the system and operational rights it has built and owned.

The Orion variable is a variable star that exhibits irregularities and luminous emission variations, usually associated with diffuse nebulae, with wavelength fluctuations of up to several magnitudes. It is believed that these are young stars that will become normal, non-variable, zero-age main sequence stars in the future. T Taurus is a Orion variable star, with fluorescent violet emission lines uniquely characterized by iron ions (Fe II) in the star's spectral spectrum, as well as emission lines of lithium, a metal that is usually destroyed in the star's nuclear fusion. FU Ori (FU Orionis) is commonly referred to as "Fuors". Its brightness first rises to 5-6 magnitudes, then sinks to a quantum level, and maintains that magnitude for decades. FU Orionis is a prototype of such a variable star, and other samples include V1057 Cygnus and V1515 Cygnus.

Bolshevik Victory Russian Empire ➝ Provisional Government ➝ Soviet Russia March 8–15, 1917: Imperial Government March 15, 1917: Provisional Government March 8–15, 1917: Constitutional Democratic Party Russian Social Democratic Labour Party Petrograd Soviet Union March 15, 1917: March 8–15, 1917: Emperor Nicholas II March 15, 1917: March 8–15, 1917: March 15, 1917: The Russian Revolution (Russian: Смена власти в России в 1917—1918 годах) is a series of revolutionary movements that took place in Russia in 1917.

阮高祺. General of the Air Force of the Republic of Vietnam, formerly Commander-in-Chief of the Air Force of the Republic of Vietnam, retired from politics. Born on September 8, 1930, in Shanxi Province in northern Vietnam, he is the third and only son of a teacher named Nguyen Quoc. Nguyen Quoc was born in the early 1950s at the first and only pre-service military officer school in northern Vietnam established by the Vietnamese state with the support of France. After leaving the school, he joined the Air Force, serving as a former senator and as Commander-in-Chief of the Air Force. He served as Chairman of the Central Executive Committee, Prime Minister (1965-1967) and Vice President (1967-1971). He was an ally and opponent of President Nguyễn Văn Thiệu, and was considered an ally of anti-communist ideology until 1975. After the 1975 430 incident, he went to the United States to live. In the United States, he continued to criticize Nguyễn Văn Thiệu and Communism.

The National Government Committee is the administrative organ of the Wang Jingwei regime. According to the Law on the Organization of the National Government of the Republic of China, promulgated by the Wang Jingwei regime, the National Government Committee is composed of the President of the National Government and the members of the National Government, and the choice is made by the Central Political Committee. On March 30, 1940, when the National Government was established in Nanjing, Wang Jingwei was appointed as the Deputy President of the National Government (who was still serving as the President of the National Government in Linsen, Chongqing at the time). The Central Political Committee met on November 28, the same year, and amended the Law on the Organization of the National Government of the Republic of China, deleting the provisions that "the President shall not bear actual political responsibility" and "the President shall not hold any other official positions," and elected Wang Jingwei as the President of the National Government. In 1944, Wang Jingwei went to Japan for treatment due to his deteriorating condition, and on March 22, the Central Political Committee held an interim meeting.

The Eighth Army of the National Revolutionary Army was formed five times: in 1926, 1931, 1937, 1938 and 1941. In June 1926, the Fourth Division of the Shogun and Yeqi Brigade were reorganized into the Eighth Army of the National Revolutionary Army. Chi Tang was appointed commander, Liu Wenshima was appointed party representative and former head of the Political Department of the General Headquarters of the Enemy, Ho Jian was appointed commander of the Second Division, Li Pingxian was appointed commander of the Third Division, Liu Xing was appointed commander of the Fourth Division, Yeqi was appointed commander of the Fifth Division, Zhou Luang was appointed instructor-in-chief, Xia Toon was appointed commander of the First Division of the O Army, and Harun was appointed independent commander. In July 1926, the Eighth Army of the National Revolutionary Army participated in the Northern Campaign of the National Revolutionary Army, capturing Changsha (the Second Battle of Changsha) and Yuezhou (the Third Battle of Yuezhou). On September 6, it attacked Khangyang. In April 1927, Li Pingxian was appointed commander. In August 1928, the Eighth Army was reorganized into the Fifty-first Division of the National Revolutionary Army.

In January 1927, the Sixth Army was formed within the Northern Expeditionary Army's Jiangyu Army (Chief Commander Cheng Qian), from Jiangxi to Anhui. Cheng Qian twice rejected Chiang Kai-shek's order to suspend attacks on Nanjing on the grounds of "strong enemy forces" - Chiang Kai-shek demanded that Cheng Qian's unit wait for the Jiang Left Army, which was fighting from Shanghai to Danyang and under the command of Ho Ying-chin, to besiege Nanjing together. Cheng Qian approached the front line, attacked Nanjing on March 24, 1927, and achieved its first victory. In 1928, the Xiang Gui Joint Army attacked Tang Seng-chi, Cheng Qian's Sixth Army helped Li Zongren to open the gateway between the forces of Gui and Guangxi. However, on May 21, 1928, Li Zongren, on the pretext of "despotism, seizure of Xiang's government", imprisoned Cheng Qian, and announced that he would be relieved of his duties. Meanwhile, Cheng Qian's Sixth Army was quickly divided, and the Sixth Army was first led by the acting commander of the 17th Division, Li Mingqiao.

In September 2017, the General Office of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the General Office of the State Council issued the General Program for Establishing the System of National Parks.On March 17, 2018, the First Session of the Thirteenth National People's Congress adopted the Decision of the First Session of the Thirteenth National People's Congress on the Institutional Reform Program of the State Council, and approved the Institutional Reform Program of the State Council.According to the Institutional Reform Program of the State Council, it was decided to integrate the management functions of the former departments of the State Forestry Bureau, the Ministry of Land Resources, the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Construction, the Ministry of Water Resources, the Ministry of Agriculture, the State Oceanic Bureau, and other departments, such as the nature reserves, scenic spots, natural heritage, geological parks, and so on, and to form the State Forestry and Grassland Bureau, which is administered by the Ministry of Natural Resources, along with one agency of the National Park Administration.On April 10, 2018, the State Forestry and Grassland Bureau (National Park Administration) was officially established.

During the Wei and Jin dynasties, a book titled "Zimin Yagyu" describes the biological characteristics of vegetables and their cultivation techniques. In the Han and Tang Dynasties, following the west region of Zhangjiatong, many vegetables were imported from Hudi and Nanban. In the Song and Ming Dynasties, the poem "Wuji is full of vegetables at four o'clock every day, the first comes after the second comes alive" further illustrated the prosperity of vegetable cultivation. After the Ming and Qing dynasties, the variety of vegetables was constantly increasing. Vegetables are important by-products, and there are different types of vegetables in all seasons. Not only do they provide a variety of foods, increase appetite, but they also provide the body with the nutrients it needs to maintain its health. In recent years, there has been more evidence that consuming vegetables and fruits is less dangerous for cancer and is ten times more beneficial to the body. Vegetables are the main sources of minerals and vitamins it needs. Although vegetables are rich in nutrients and healthy health components, in order for these nutrient values to play their role, it is necessary to pay attention to the quality of vegetables.

After the outbreak of the war, Liu Changyi organized the volunteer army in Zhangjiakou. After Zhangjiakou was lost, he retreated along the Tailing Mountains with Liu Yeming's unit to Qinyang, Henan Province. In 1938, he was incorporated into the 1st War Area Yubei Detachment Army. In the spring of 1940, Liu Changyi's leadership attacked Japan near Wen County, Henan Province. It was reorganized into the Peace-Building Army Yubei Suijing Command and 21st Division. On September 21, 1941, anyway, more than 600 Japanese troops were exterminated, Nantou Huang River crossed into the 1st War Area, was reorganized into the Interim 15th Army, belonged to the 28th Army: In April 1943, the Deputy Commander of the 1st War Area Tom Eun-bak annexed the army, the 27th Division was reorganized into the 85th Army, the 1st Brigade was reorganized into the 15th Army, and the new 29th Division, the 11th Reserve Division of the 85th Army under the direct control of the 31st Army was reorganized into the Interim 15th Army. In July 1944, the 27th Division (with Xiao Jing as commander) was reorganized from the 85th Army.

The website is one of the most important Chinese news websites in the world. It publishes news information in seven languages: Chinese (简,繁), English, French, Western, Russian, Arabic and Japanese, all the time without interruption, and has a daily circulation of nearly 4,500 articles. The content is mainly news, divided into two main sections: news section and news section. It includes 14 news categories, including domestic, international, financial, securities, sports, science and technology, IT, legal, social, entertainment, education, campus, reading, automobile, etc. On August 21, 2003, it began to disseminate news, music, sports, education, science and technology, and financial multimedia programs to domestic and international audiences.

In 1937, with the help of the Soviet Union, the government of the Qing dynasty finally appeased the rebel forces in the province. In the early days of the late Qing dynasty, the Uyghurs in the territory of the Hami were administered by the Hami dynasty. In the Qing Kangxi period, the Hami chief, Nubedullah, was entrusted with the position of Zasakh, the same as the Zasakh of the Mongolian flags (flag chiefs), and Luson was the chieftain of the mainland. The descendants of Nubedullah were enfeoffed to Prince Kazuo because of military achievements. At the time of the establishment of Xinjiang province in the late Qing Dynasty, Prince Hami was not stripped of his powers and became the only domain king of the entire province. After the Xinhai Revolution, Yang Xinxiang reigned as the new ruler of Xinjiang, retaining the title and power of Prince Hami. In 1930, Prince Hami died. Xinjiang provincial chairman Jin Jinjun decided to abolish the Hami dynasty and to revert to the mainland.

On March 15, 1936, 19-year-old Zhang Chunqiao published an article titled "Let's Execute Self-criticism," under the pen name "Dick," in the supplement "Torch" of the Tai Evening Post. In response to Zhou Yang's slogan of "Defense Literature," Zhang believed that the writer Tianjun (Shao Jun's pen name) had left northeastern China too early, and that his work "The Countryside in August" was not real enough. "After the arrest of the Gang of Four," the official media accused Zhang of "serving under the command of Special Agent Cui Wanqiu in the cultural movement, pseudonym "Dick" madly attacking Lu Xun." In 1936, Song Zhending (pseudonym Wu Chengzhi, the director of the Forestry Department of Inner Mongolia after the establishment of the Chinese Communist Party), Lin Fuxing, and other party members who lost contact with the CCP party organization organized a committee of party members to prepare the CCP, and developed some left-wing members to join the Communist Party.

Tainan Theological Seminary (Chinese: 台南神学院; pinyin: 南神) is a theological seminary belonging to the Presbyterian Church of Taiwan in the southern part of Taiwan, with the aim of cultivating joint pastoral clergy and ministers to serve the Church and Taiwanese society as a God-willed nation. The founding of the seminary dates back to 1869, when Dr. Mayakovsky and Rev. Li Xiang founded the missionary training class in Fucheng after the flag, and in 1876, Rev. Buckley merged the two into Fucheng College, which had been shut down several times due to the war. The current campus was established in 1903, renamed "Tainan Theological Seminary" in 1913, and changed its name to "Tainan Theological Seminary" in 1948, and then approved by the Ministry of Education of the Republic of China in 2017 to establish "Tainan Theological Seminary of the Presbyterian Church of Taiwan," a joint university to this day. Located in the Dong'anfang Cultural Park in Tainan City, Yan'o District, Kaohsiung City [Tainan Theological Seminary] (under the Ministry of the Interior) [Tainan Theological Seminary of the Presbyterian Church of Taiwan] (under the Ministry of Education) "Original Tainan Theological Seminary School and Chapel" is a schoolhouse built during the Japanese occupation of Taiwan, that is, today's Buckley Memorial Hall and Chapel was designated as a Historic Site of Tainan City in 2002.

The Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) and the Republic of China Armed Forces (RAF) used artillery bombardment as their main tactical operations, hence the term artillery warfare. On August 23, 1958, the PLA launched the first artillery warfare, and the RAF immediately began to counterattack. In the early stages of the artillery warfare, the PLA attacked military targets on the island, and later severely blockaded the shipping lanes in order to encircle Kinmen. In the early stages of the artillery warfare, the RAF suddenly failed to defend itself, and as the fighting continued, it gradually regained its strength; it maintained the supply lines at Kinmen. During the artillery warfare, both naval vessels and air forces fought repeatedly. In early October, the PLA abandoned the blockade, changing it to "one-on-one, two-on-two" (one-on-one, two-on-two), and gradually reduced its offensive. Thereafter, the Republic of China successfully defended the Jinma area. The PRC maintained one-on-one, two-on-two until January 1, 1979, the day of the establishment of diplomatic relations with the United States, when it formally declared a ceasefire through the Letter to the Taiwan Compatriots.

A CAS number is divided into three parts by the character "-", the first part has two to seven digits, the second part has two digits, and the third part has one digit as the calibration code. The CAS number is ordered in ascending order and has no intrinsic meaning. The calibration code is calculated as follows: The last digit of the CAS sequence number (first and second digits) is multiplied by 1, the last digit is multiplied by 2, and so on, and then all the product is added, divided and subtracted by 10, and the remainder is the calibration code of the third part. For example, for water (H2O) the first two digits of the CAS number are 7732-18, the calibration code is ( 8×1 + 1×2 + 2×3 + 3×4 + 7×5 + 7×6 ) mod 10 = 105 mod 10 = 5 (mod is the residual operator) Different isomer molecules have different CAS numbers, for example, the CAS number for right glucose is 50-99-7, the CAS number for left glucose is 921-60-8, and the calibration code for alpha right glucose (α-D-glucose) is 26655-34-5.

After the October Revolution in Russia, the contradiction between the West and the Soviet Union intensified due to ideological and territorial expansionist reasons. The contradiction developed into the late 1930s, the main strategic opponent of England and France was the Soviet Union, while the conflict with Germany on Eastern European interests became more and more acute. Nazi Germany also opposed communism, and the rise of Nazi Germany prevented the Soviet Union from seizing Polish territory. Therefore, the game and struggle between the West, Germany and the Soviet Union began. Hitler planned to invade Poland, to connect East Prussia with Germany's mainland, and to intensify preparations for the expansion of aggression to the West. Faced with the aggressive mood of Germany, "Britain and France and others resigned, did not prepare to fight Germany, hoped that Germany would stop expanding", a policy of appeasement was adopted against Germany. To this end, England and France also signed the Munich Agreement with Germany, so that Hitler would be satisfied with the acquisition of the Sudetenland.

In 1937, due to the outbreak of the Pacific War, Taiwan changed to use "Central Standard Time" (UTC+9), until the defeat of Japan in 1945. In 1918, the Government of the Republic of China Central Observatory divided the country into five standard time zones, of which "Central Standard Time" is eight hours faster than the world time (UTC+8). After the return of Taiwan in 1945, Taiwan joined the Chinese Standard Time "Central Standard Time Zone". At that time, the Ministry of the Interior of the Republic of China was in charge of the relevant affairs of the time zone, the Central Research Institute and other organizations were responsible for the actual allocation of time. According to the time zone stipulated in the "Method of Implementation of Standard Time in All Regions of the Country" promulgated by the Government of the Republic of China in 1947, all Taiwanese radio and television stations used the term "Central Standard Time" when reporting. In 2005, the Standards Review Bureau of the Ministry of Economy stated that a set of national time standards has now been established, which is a unit of measurement of time in Taiwan, does not include the term "Central Standard Time" or "Taiwan Time" and does not intend to name it.

(The Hong Kong Working Committee of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, the Macao Working Committee of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Macao Special Administrative Region, one institution and two blocks, are included in the list of organs directly under the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.) (The Party Academy of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Academy of Administration, one institution and two blocks.) The Institute of Party History and Literature of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China is attached to the CPC Central Bureau of Compilation.) (The Central Archives and the State Archives Bureau, the Office of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Security Bureau, the Office of the Leading Group of the Central Coding Working Party and the State Coding Administration, one institution and two blocks) The First Plenary Meeting (the Twenty-first Plenary Session) was held on October 23, 2022. The Meeting elected the members of the new Politburo of the Communist Party of China, the Standing Committee and the General Secretary, and on the basis of the nomination of the Standing Committee of the new Politburo of the Communist Party of China, elected the members of the new Central Registry of the Communist Party of China, decided the members of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China, and approved the election of the secretaries, deputy secretaries and members of the Standing Committee elected at the First Plenary Meeting of the Twenty-first Central Commission for Disciplinary Inspection.

King Haakon and his government fled the United Kingdom, the Germans intended to use the Norwegian heavy water factory to produce heavy water for the production of atomic bombs, but were destroyed by the Allies. The German military controlled the entire territory of Norway until the German surrender on 8 May 1945, when the army in Norway was disarmed. World War II ended as one of the victorious nations. In 1949, Norway joined the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. In 1945, the Norwegian people's cruelty to Norwegian women and their children, street demonstrations, torture, and other inhumane acts, which were associated with the Germans, was satirized as a "new generation of Nazis." In 1957, Haakon VII died, and his son succeeded him as Olaf V. In 1959, he joined the European Free Trade Union. In 1972 and 1994, he voted twice to join the European Union, but did not pass, and since then the proportion of people who opposed joining the European Union has been higher than those who supported joining the European Union.

It is an international system of states, transnational corporations and organizations that began with the signing of the Treaty of Westphalia in 1648. Sovereignty is a term that is often misused. "Perhaps there is no more controversial concept than sovereignty," said Lassa Oppenheim. "From the moment it was introduced into political science until today, there has never been a concept that has a universally accepted meaning. It is an indisputable fact." Although the terms "state" and "government" are often used interchangeably, in general, states are enduring entities, although they may disappear through voluntary means or external forces (such as military conquest). Since the end of World War II, the practice of violent abolition of state power has virtually ceased.

China's ancient inventions, such as compass, papermaking, printing and gunpowder, have contributed greatly to the development of the world. It also has an advanced agriculture and handicrafts industry. China is rich in natural resources. Between 1860 and 1945, the British, French, American, German, Italian, Russian, Japanese, Austro-Hungarian and Belgian governments signed treaties and agreements in the southeastern direction of the old city of Tianjin, China. Tianjin has administrative autonomy and extraterritorial jurisdiction. At the same time, Tianjin was one of the first cities in China to reclaim the territory. In 1945, after the victory in the war against Japan, the Government of the Republic of China formally reclaimed the last two territories in Tianjin - the British and French territories, marking the end of the history of the Tianjin Territory.

In the mid-latitudes of the Northern Hemisphere, the best time to observe zodiacal light is in the western sky after the complete disappearance of the dawn of spring, or in the eastern sky before the dawn of autumn. Because zodiacal light is very faint, moonlight or light pollution can easily cover the ecliptic light. The intensity of the ecliptic light decreases with distance from the Sun, but it can also be observed on very dark nights to envelop the entire ecliptic. In fact, the ecliptic light is scattered throughout the sky, accounting for about 60% of the total brightness of the night sky on clear moonless nights.

On March 13, 2017, at the 12th NCC's 5th meeting, Special Representative Leung Chong-ying was elected Vice President by 2,066 votes in favor, 13 against and 16 abstentions. Leung Chong-ying also served as both Head of State and Chief Executive. Since May 2018, Leung Chong-ying has used his Facebook account to "snipe" pro-democracy activists and organizations, as well as the government's education department, to become an opinion leader representing the views of the establishment. During the 2019 Anti-Reform Movement, Leung Chong-ying spearheaded the establishment of the 803 Fund, which encouraged citizens to report "riots" with a huge gold prize. Leung Chong-ying's father, Leung Chung-on (formerly known as Leung Zhao-yuan), was a police officer recruited from Shandong Weihaiwei in the early days of the establishment of the Hong Kong Police Force, commonly referred to as "the Shandong defector," who had been stationed at the Governor's Office and at the top of the mountain. Leung Chong-ying has a sister and a sister, and is the only child in the family, ranked second in the family.

Suyuan Station is a transfer station of Line 6 and Line 21 of Guangzhou Metro, located at the base of Kaizoo Avenue, Kofeng Road and Shui Xi intersection in Huangpu District, Guangzhou City, Guangdong Province, China. It was opened on December 28, 2016 with the opening of the second phase of Line 6, and on December 20, 2019 with the opening of the remaining section of Line 21. The station has three floors. The ground floor is Kaizoo Avenue, Kofeng Road, Shui Xi Road, Luogang Wanda Plaza, and other small areas or buildings. The basement floor is the station hall, the basement two floors are Platform 6, and the basement three floors are Platform 21. The station hall of Suyuan Station is arranged in the "Na" type layout, the north-south part is Line 21, the east-west part is Line 6, and the station hall of Line 21 is divided into two parts north-south by the station hall of Line 6. Chávez entered the Venezuelan Military Academy at the age of 17. In 1975, he received a degree in military science and engineering as a second lieutenant, then served for several months as a candidate lieutenant, and was then admitted to study political science at the Simon Bolivar University in Caracas, but did not obtain a degree. While at the university, Chávez and several partners conceived a left-wing nationalist theory, they called it "Bolivarianismo", inspired by the 19th-century Venezuelan revolutionary Simon Bolivar, who also influenced the Peruvian dictator Juan Velasco Alvarado and many socialist and communist leaders. During these years, Chávez also became passionate about sports news and cultural activities.

On June 8, Yuan issued the Provisional Presidential Decree, declaring the five-colored flag to be the legal national flag of the Republic of China: At this time, the five-colored flag is normally raised at seven o'clock in the morning and lowered at six o'clock in the evening when in use. When not in use, one color should be folded into a layer, red on top and black on the bottom, rolled from the waist of the flag into a cylinder-shaped section, and stitched out with single strands of wire. In 1914, after the failure of the Second Revolution, Sun Yat-sen published the Chinese Revolutionary Party Revolutionary Formula, in the formula, "Part I Military Politics", "Part III Flag and Conscription" of Chapter I General Provisions", Article 8 "The Republic of China uses the blue sky and white sun flag as the national flag, the graph reads as follows: the flag is red on the ground, the blue sky and white sun as the chapter, the chapter is at the top corner of the flag. The flag is blue on the ground, the circle is white on the sun, the edge is still blue, the sun is decorated with twelve rays of light.

Guangzhou taxi refers to the taxi service in Guangzhou, Guangdong Province, China, is one of the main public transportation in Guangzhou, local people call taxi (translated from English "Taxi"), taxi rides are called "hit". In 1915 (four years of the Republic of China), Malay overseas Chinese raised funds from Hong Kong to buy several old cars, after repairs, Guangzhou operated taxi service. This was the first taxi service in Guangzhou. By 1933, the city had 631 taxis, all from the United Kingdom, the United States, Japan and other countries. During the period of the Republic of China, taxi service for the general public, various taxi companies, carriages throughout the city of Guangzhou, in the 36th year of the Republic of China (1947), at least 15 taxi rental companies were provided: After the establishment of the government in mid-1949, all taxi companies were suppressed, taxis became specially responsible for receiving foreign heads of state, heads of government and senior officials, foreign merchants participating in trade fairs, overseas Chinese, compatriots from Hong Kong and Macao, etc.

Moreover, each bus had two doors for passengers to get on and off, and the doors were pulled by the conductors themselves. When traffic was heavy or vehicles were scarce, it was often the case that each bus blocked the congestion of at least 50 passengers. In 1926, there were more than 20 car companies operating in Guangzhou, so the municipal authorities formulated the "Guangzhou City Passenger Car Charter", which stipulated that passenger car operations were to be tendered in a competitive manner, and the bus handling rights were granted to four companies: Li Bing, Li Min, National, and Model. Between 1926 and 1928, there were only 10 buses, and a year later, 10 buses were added. In 1928, Guangzhou City Hall officially delineated the bus routes, divided into three lines: the red line from Guangdong 9 Railway Station to Puji Bridge, the yellow line from Huang Sha to Dongshan Park, and the green line from Puji Bridge to Daxin Company.

Its orbit has an eccentricity of 0.0022 and an inclination of 0.02° relative to the equator of Saturn. It is in the same orbit as Saturn. Saturn XII is located on the L4 Lagrangian point of Saturn, 60° in front of Saturn IV. Saturn IV has an average diameter of 1118 kilometers. Saturn IV is mainly composed of ice, but it is the third densest of Saturn's moons (1.5 g/cm3, Saturn II and Saturn VI are in the first and second positions), so its interior must contain a considerable amount of silicate rock. Saturn IV has an irradiance of 0.55 and is darker than Saturn III and Saturn II. Saturn IV has a surface temperature of -187 °C. Its rotation period is the same as its orbital period, and is 65 hours 41 minutes, so it rotates synchronously with Earth's satellites.
